title: ARCS Model-Based Motivational Design Process for Enhancing e-Learning Quality and Usability

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: Enhancing e-learning quality improvement capabilities required for designing and operating language education courses for novice learners composed of in-service professionals.

learning_goals: Learners can design motivation-enhanced e-learning modules by applying the four elements of the ARCS model (Attention, Relevance, Confidence, Satisfaction)
Learners can create feedback checklists that integrate usability and affective factors (motivation) when evaluating e-learning quality
Learners can develop a prototype of a responsive language learning interface implementable in BYOD environments
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
